com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class SimpleTextSymbol

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseSymbol
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseFontSymbol
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseTextSymbol
                    |
                    +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.SimpleTextSymbol
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Symbol, TextSymbol
public class SimpleTextSymbol
extends BaseTextSymbol

Provides a simple text to put over the map by labeling process.

This symbol works to label polygon line or point layers by interactive with label engine.

The symbol supports next attrites:

Antialiasing can be true or false, default is false.

Transparency is transparency from 0.0 to 1.0, default is 1.0

Font is font for textstring, default is "Dialog" PLAIN and 12 height.

Color is textstring color, default is black.

Outline is color for border around each letter, default is null (no outline).

Glowing is color for glowing around the textstring, default is null (no glowing).

Shadow is color for shadow behind the textstring, default is null (no shadow).

BlockOut is color of background box drawing around the textstring, default is null (no blockout).

FeatureWeight, LabelWeight, LabelBufferRatio, HowManyLabels, LabelPriorities.

RotationalAngles, LineLabelPosition have a special mean, see LabelEngine for details.

PrintMode defines type of print mode TileCaps, AllUpper, AllLower or None.

The result of the next example is shown on the picture.

stSymbol.setAntialiasing(true);
stSymbol.setTransparency(0.6);
stSymbol.setFont( new Font("Courier", Font.Plain, 20) );
stSymbol.setOutline( new Color(255,0,0) );
stSymbol.setGlowing(new Color(0,128,0) );
stSymbol.setShadow( new Color(64,64,64) );
stSymbol.setBlockout( new Color(0,255,0) );

See Also:
BaseSymbol, LabelEngine, BaseFontSymbol.PRINTMODE_NONE, BaseFontSymbol.PRINTMODE_TITLECAPS, BaseFontSymbol.PRINTMODE_ALLUPPER, BaseFontSymbol.PRINTMODE_ALLOWER

Method Detail

prepare

public void prepare(String text,
                    FeatureGeometry fg,
                    Transform transform)
This method provide the parameters for drawing. The method should not be call directly, but label engine only.

Parameters:
text - is a textstring to be drawing
fg - is feature geometry to be labeled
transform - is transform object to describe the current map transform
See Also:
TextSymbol.prepare(java.lang.String, com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.FeatureGeometry, com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Transform)

draw

public void draw(String text,
                 double x,
                 double y,
                 double angle,
                 Graphics2D g2,
                 FeatureGeometry fg)
this method is called by a Labeling to render a label. Rotation's pivot point is the center of the label point (x,y)

Parameters:
text - the label text
x - the x coordinate of the label text center
y - the y coordinate of the label text center
angle - the rotation angle in radians
g2 - the graphic context
fg - the feature location
See Also:
TextSymbol.draw(java.lang.String, double, double, double, java.awt.Graphics2D, com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.FeatureGeometry)
